title: Lola's Secret Chicken Adobo
description: My grandmother's recipe passed down for 3 generations. The secret is the coconut vinegar!
instructions: Combine chicken, vinegar, soy sauce, garlic, bay leaves, and peppercorns in a pot
Let it marinate for 30 minutes (Lola's tip: overnight is better!)
Bring to boil then simmer for 30 minutes
Add brown sugar and simmer until sauce thickens
For extra flavor, fry the chicken pieces after simmering
tips: Use sukang tuba for authentic taste
Don't stir when it first boils - let the vinegar cook out

title: Bicol Express na Hindi Sobrang Anghang
description: Perfect for those who love Bicol Express but can't handle too much spice. Creamy and flavorful!
instructions: Saut√© garlic, onion, and ginger until fragrant
Add pork belly and cook until slightly browned
Pour coconut milk and simmer until pork is tender
Add bagoong and chilies, stir well
Pour coconut cream and simmer until oil separates
Adjust spice level by adding or removing chilies
tips: Remove chili seeds for less heat
Best served with hot rice

title: Student Budget Sisig
description: Masarap na sisig kahit walang pig face! Perfect for college students on a budget üí∏
instructions: Boil pork until tender, then chop finely
Fry chopped pork until crispy
Add butter, onion, soy sauce, and calamansi
Mix in mayonnaise and chili flakes
Serve on sizzling plate with raw egg on top
Mix everything together while hot!
tips: Chicken liver adds authentic flavor if you have budget
Serve immediately while sizzling

title: Nanay's Sinigang na Baboy
description: The perfect sinigang - sour enough to make you sweat but not too sour. Just like how Nanay makes it.
instructions: Boil pork ribs until tender (about 45 mins)
Add sampalok and boil for 10 minutes, then mash and strain
Add tomatoes and onion, simmer for 5 minutes
Add radish and eggplant, cook until tender
Add sitaw and green chili
Add kangkong last (it cooks fast!)
Season with fish sauce
tips: Fresh sampalok is better than powder
Add kangkong only when ready to serve

title: Crispy Tokwa't Baboy
description: The perfect pulutan! Crispy tofu, tender pork, and that addicting sawsawan üç∫
instructions: Boil pork belly until tender, then slice
Deep fry tofu until golden and crispy
Cut tofu into cubes
Make sawsawan: mix soy sauce, vinegar, onion, garlic, chili, and sugar
Arrange tofu and pork on plate
Serve with sawsawan on the side
tips: Press tofu to remove water for extra crispiness
Best with ice cold beer!

title: Easy Champorado for Lazy Mornings
description: 5-minute champorado when you're too tamad to cook pero gusto mo ng comfort food
instructions: Boil water and add glutinous rice
Stir occasionally until rice is cooked
Add tablea/cocoa and sugar, mix until dissolved
Cook until desired thickness
Serve with evaporated milk drizzle
Pair with tuyo for the ultimate combo!
tips: Leftover rice works too!
Add more chocolate for richer taste

title: Air Fryer Lechon Kawali
description: Crispy lechon kawali without the oil splatter! Air fryer is a game changer üî•
instructions: Boil pork belly with salt, pepper, and bay leaves until tender (45 mins)
Remove and pat completely dry (important!)
Rub with garlic powder and extra salt
Refrigerate uncovered for 2 hours (or overnight for crispier skin)
Air fry at 400¬∞F for 20-25 minutes, flipping halfway
Let rest for 5 minutes before slicing
tips: Dry skin = crispy skin
Poke holes in skin for extra crunch

title: Instant Pot Kare-Kare
description: Traditional kare-kare made easy with Instant Pot. Tender beef in 1 hour! ü•ú
instructions: Pressure cook oxtail and tripe for 45 minutes
Saut√© garlic and onion in annatto oil
Add peanut butter and meat broth, stir well
Add ground toasted rice to thicken
Add vegetables according to cooking time
Simmer until vegetables are tender
Serve with bagoong on the side
tips: Toast rice and grind for authentic thickness
Homemade bagoong is best!

title: Pork and Chicken Adobo
description: A traditional Filipino adobo featuring both pork and chicken, cooked in a rich soy sauce and vinegar sauce with the perfect balance of savory and tangy flavors. This recipe uses the classic 2:1 vinegar to soy sauce ratio.
instructions: Heat pot on high heat and add pork
Add Silver Swan vinegar (2 parts) and Tapati soy sauce (1 part)
Add garlic, Nori seasoning, bay leaves, sugar, and peppercorns
Add water to cover meat and simmer 40-45 minutes
Add chicken and cook another 20 minutes covered
Boil eggs for 11 minutes, then ice bath and peel
Remove meat, reduce sauce on high heat with mushroom seasoning
Add cornstarch slurry to thicken
Return meat and add boiled eggs, rest 10 minutes
Serve with jasmine rice, garnish with crispy onions, garlic, Thai chili, and scallions
tips: Chicken legs don't dry out easily
Adding fat from pork makes it more flavorful
Adobo tastes even better the next day

title: Crispy Pork Belly
description: A Filipino dish featuring crispy pork belly with a savory sauce made with apple, sesame oil, peanut butter, and honey.
instructions: Boil pork belly in water with onions, salt, pepper, and bay leaves until tender
Break the skin of the pork belly
Dry the pork belly in the oven
Fry the pork belly in beef fat until crispy
Prepare sauce with apple, sesame oil, garlic, onions, salt, peanut butter, soy sauce, and honey
tips: Break the skin to dry it out properly
Peanut butter adds extra flavor to the sauce

title: Garlic Butter Chicken
description: A simple and flavorful Filipino chicken dish cooked with garlic and butter. Quick and easy to make!
instructions: Melt butter in a pan over low-medium heat
Add minced garlic and cook for around one minute until fragrant
Add the chicken seasoning
Add the chicken pieces
Cook the chicken until fully cooked and absorbed the flavors
Serve hot
tips: Don't burn the garlic - use low-medium heat
Let chicken absorb all the buttery garlic flavor
